_header: In a chamber as I stood
Note: The same refrain occurs also in 2407.
_description: ‘Seruice is noon heritage’ — nine 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) with this refrain

BodRawPoe36.First Lines:
In a Chambre as I stodeThere lordys were and baronis
                    bold…
BodRawPoe36.Last Lines:
…lesyth þer seruice wondyr lyeffor seruice is noon
                    eritage
BodRawPoe36.Editions:
Sandison,  Helen Estabrook. 
             The ‘Chanson d’Aventure’ in Middle English.
Bryn Mawr College Monographs,  Monograph Series 12. Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1913: 119-20.

NLS1931.First Lines:
In a chambre as I stodeÞere lordes were & barons
                    bold…
NLS1931.Last Lines:
…for þis avaunte I dare wele makehis service is gud
                    heritage
NLS1931.Note: Written as if it follows lines 1-12 of 631.
NLS1931.Attributed Title: Serves is no heritage (added by later hand, top of f. 91)
NLS1931.Facsimiles:
Hardman,  Phillipa. 
             The Heege Manuscript: A Facsimile of National Library of Scotland MS
                Advocates 19.3.1.
         Leeds Texts and Monographs, n.s. 16. Leeds: School of English,
            2000.
